website_summaries.verdict: Excellent fabric scissors for anyone who suffers from limited hand strength or arthritis; easily cuts through thick materials.
pros: Multi-purpose scissors feature a spring action design
Stands out for their ergonomic handle with softgrip cushioning, which provides great cutting control and is comfortable to use
Bent handle helps to keep material flat for precise cutting
cons: The design makes them unsuitable for general use

customer_reviews.title: Very deceptive! You do not get what's pictured.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item because it shows fiskars 2911, the item I recieved was fiskars 9911. This is a completely different product than what is pictured!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for arthritis sufferers!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a pair of these for my grandmother who has very bad arthritis. The scissors are spring loaded, so you don't have to open and close them manually. When you're finished, you use the thumb button to lock them closed. It makes cutting so much easier, especially if you have any issues with your wrist or hands.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got these about 4 months ago and at first they worked great but now they are no longer springing back open after cutting. I set them up on fabric or paper, close them to cut and they stay closed. And since there is no loop on the top part of the handle, there is no way to "pull" them open. And no, it isn't the little lock switch. I have only been cutting lightweight fabric (cotton) and single sheets of paper. As I say, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Birgibit

customer_reviews.title: Unusable. They stay locked regardless of the position of the sliding lock.
customer_reviews.text: Update Jan2019 these were great until they wouldn't open so we couldn't use them. The slide to lock and unlock them is working fine but the scissors stay locked regardless of where the sliding lock is. Will be returning. These are wonderful for arthritic hands, especially for CMC arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars what has happened to your quality?
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I did not open this till after the return by date to Amazon. Just opened it now and it was as dull as a butter knife. Would not cut through a simple cotton fabric. Bought it for the ergonomic aspect as I have bad arthritis in both hands and thought the large handle would help. The so called "easy action" aspect is basically a spring mechanism and IMHO I had to apply more pressure than I would have with a non-easy action scissors. Plus, I have small hands and from that standpoint it felt way big an clumsy. Overall very disappointed and now cannot return.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Faust

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted longer than most of the other critical reviews so I'll give them 3 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted longer than most of the other critical reviews, but got dull way faster than my 7 year old gray pair. And now after less than a year of light use the latch that kept them closed is broken. So they're now kitchen scissors kept in the knife drawer where I keep all kitchen tools with exposed blades. My old gray pair had been demoted to paper and tape when I got these but is now back to cutting yarn and is still sharper than these were after a year of just yarn.
customer_reviews.author: AMac

customer_reviews.title: The scissors arrived and were dull in many spots.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as I am a quilter and I loved the ergonomic action for these scissors. When they arrived, they were only sharp on the top 1/3 of the blades. I can't cut fabric or just about anything else with these as they are too dull. Not worth the discounted price I paid. I can try to take them somewhere to have them sharpened, but it almost seems a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Tarkheena

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps we should have bought the full price ones
customer_reviews.text: Wife already has two of these pairs of Fiskars scissors bought in the past for her arthritic thumbs - they open and close easily and cut well - really wonderful scissors. Although these newly bought price-reduce scissors cut well, they are not like her others: they are not at all easy to open and close (they don't slide to open and to lock, they catch and so take a bit of force which she doesn't have) so she won't be able to use them. She was hoping to have two pairs upstairs. We can't return these as the package was thrown away before she actually tried them out later in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kzo

customer_reviews.title: for fabric they are the best! watch prices
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with these scissors if you cut a lot of fabric. They are the best if you have hand issues like arthritis. Do shop around and watch the price, some places really jack up the cost to customers. Now that you have them, mark FABRIC on them and threaten your family if they use them for anything else. They will last for a very long time is used properly. I buy a 10 pack of the scissors that look like Fiskars for $10.00 and stash them all over the house. It almost works.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy! - UPDATED: No longer work.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After 4 months, these scissors no longer "open" / get stuck, which defeats the entire purpose of getting them to begin with. Is there something I'm missing here about replacing the spring or oiling it? I get worse hand cramps constantly pushing the handle open after each cut than using regular scissors. As a SPED educator, I am constantly cutting, laminating, and then re-cutting things. This has reduced and removed the cramp pain from all the cutting I do. Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Allison M.

customer_reviews.title: hard to lock and unlock
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of similar Fiskar's scissors I had for many many years. These have one key difference that makes all the difference: the locking mechanism is on the side and hard to reach with my thumb. The old pair had the mechanism on top and super easy. Given that the scissors pop open when unlocked (that's the point), they have to always be locked when not in use, so being hard to close is annoying as heck. They are still nice and sharp though.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Good for Arthritic Hands
customer_reviews.text: The scissors work well and I definitely like the spring action as it does give my hand a break. I have thumb joint arthritis and this is type of scissor was recommended by the occupational therapist. I am glad to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Breen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Arthritic Fingers
customer_reviews.text: I have had arthritis for over 50 years. I still love to do crafting, however I have a hard time with regular scissors. I purchased these and what a difference! The are easy to hold, and are so easy on the hands that I can cut fabric for hours and not have swelling for joint pain. If you have arthritis in your hands or simply have a hard time with regular scissors, these scissors are what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Awkward, heavy & already broken
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought that, after a little getting used to it, I would like these scissors. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. They are heavy, partially because of the balance - or lack of it. They originally cut fairly smoothly, but after a short time owning them and not using them all that much, I find that the spring action doesn't work well anymore and they stick (no, I never used them with anything sticky or wet - only used them to cut some paper). Not a happy camper, and the return window has closed, so I'm stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ilene Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: I got these because a few reviewers mentioned they had trouble with their hands. I do also. My fingers are weak and using scissors is very uncomfortable and limiting. These are great. You press the arms together to cut and they automatically pop back up to go again. I have cut a lot of paper- did a giant sign for a birthday- and also quite a bit of material. They are very sharp, as sharp as my material sheers! These are a winner! I have not have any trouble with the sliding lock keeping them shut in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Scissors I can handle! Ergonomic, easy to handle, cuts nicely and great price for great product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so satisfied with this scissors. I have problem with my hands grabbing things and this scissors make it easier to cut different fabrics. My fingers fit perfectly, and are comfortable. I haven't experienced cramps on my hand since using them. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Cruz

customer_reviews.title: The best, my favorite
customer_reviews.text: after many years as a seamstress, my hands developed problems and regular scissors were causing me a lot of pain. These scissors are the only ones I can use that cause no pain. I wish I had discovered them years sooner, maybe I wouldn't have arthritis in both my thumbs. This is the best price I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Smithereens

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Until they totally weren’t...
customer_reviews.text: I got these while sewing masks during Covid for people. I thought they would save my hand. They did, until they stopped opening easily. They opened slowly. I loosened the screw and kind of fixed it although they were too far apart really close to the “hinge” and wouldn’t cut except the lower half. I tightened and found a sweet spot and within a week they were doing the same thing. I loosened again and decided to just return them. I have never messed with scissors this much. Ain’t nobody got time for that!
customer_reviews.author: Momtographer

customer_reviews.title: The best scissors for arthritic hands!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could have a 2 nd pair. My 1st pair are 15 years old and still work fine but have a nick in the blade. The new pair work fine and seem a bit lighter and the locking feature a bit less smooth. I bought them for the spring action which is so much easier on my arthritic hands and the cutting action is precise. Fiskars are the only brand I have bought since I discovered this brand. I also have the sharpener which assures me of a nice sharp blade at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Monardia

customer_reviews.title: Must have product for my sewing needs
customer_reviews.text: Fiskar scissors are a staple for my sewing notions. These are so easy to pick up and begin to use after setting them down. There are no messy holes to stick fingers into to begin to cut. They are very sharp and easy to use. They maintain your sharpness after years of use. As a seamstress I reserve all of my sewing scissors for cutting fabric only. I never use them for any use other than that. They have far surpassed any expectations I have had of them. The price on Amazon for these scissors is spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Warranty...who knew?
customer_reviews.text: I love these scissors. I've tried a few, but these work best for me. I use them to cut raw meat into tiny pieces for my chihuahuas. They only last about a year, before the spring breaks. I was about to order again, and happen to notice the warranty on the back of the package, which I had saved. I called Customer Service and they are sending me two new springs, free of charge. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Lori S.

customer_reviews.title: MUST PURCHASE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i do a lot of lamination and cutting for work, and OMG! you need these in your life!!! if you are someone who is cutting things a lot, these are for you. you do not have to use your hand muscle to open the scissors. you also dont have the stress of the scissor handles digging into your hand. the scissors shoot open for you, and all you do is close them. it does not sound all that great, but if you have had to cut things to the point where your hand is cramping really bad, you need these. i will never not have a pair.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Used about 10 times, spring now seems corroded, won't open unless forced.
customer_reviews.text: Review for Fiskars No.8 Premier Easy Action Bent Scissors. Used approx 10 times over past 2 months, to cut only soft fabric. Scissors stick now and won't open unless force them. Have used other Fiskars fabric scissors for 18 years. Got this pair and have been disappointed. Wanted to post this for seller, to give them opportunity to exchange for new pair, but this review seems only option showing.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these due to my thumb injury, which makes it hard or sometimes impossible to squeeze regular scissors. These are perfect for me because they require minimal effort behind the squeezing and most of the work comes from the hand /4 finger grip instead of the thumb on top. They’ve popped open a couple of times when closed with the latch, but I may Just not have pushed it closed enough. These cut smooth, straight and very easily!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars are simply the best made
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use without causing strain to my hands, They don't make my hands tired like other scissors I own. The design makes these perfect for cutting out patterns with ease. They are really sharp so the fabric cuts smooth and even every time
customer_reviews.author: PattyH

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for my hand.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these scissors to use solely on fabric. I was looking forward to loving my new scissors. But I was surprised at how uncomfortable they are for me to use. The issue is the large opening. My hand is uncomfortable no matter where I position it. I am using the scissors with my hand all the way forward in the opening, having tried other positions. Sad to say I am not in love with my new scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have!
customer_reviews.text: If your a crafter or quilter these are a must have! I use them for my rag quilt and it helped me cut without killing my hand!
customer_reviews.author: TStark

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy these again..
customer_reviews.text: These are disappointing. Not as good as older models. These stick and won't open. They have a spring in them but they don't bounce back open. Wish I could get s refund or better pair. I use to love my old pair.
customer_reviews.author: Niecey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scissorsThis
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time and in perfect condition. They fit perfectly in my hand and I have very OLD hands. The spring action is a great idea and makes cutting fabric so easy. The scissors cut thought fabric like a knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: drashlene

customer_reviews.title: Lacking quality control
customer_reviews.text: The first pair I got was great. It was sharp and the spring action worked beautifully. When it was time to replace it I decided to stick to the same model. Why fix it if it’s not broken. Well the 2nd pair is completely useless. The spring action doesn’t work at all. So in addition to squeezing the scissors closed I have to manually reopen it. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Celine W

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars sewing scissors
customer_reviews.text: Cut the fabric evenly. Are ergonomically designed, especially for hands and wrists with arthritis and carpal tunnel. Love these scissors. Best pair of scissors that I own for sewing needs.
customer_reviews.author: pvvillemar

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with these scissors! They do not aggravate my arthritis! They slice through my fabric like butter. Since I am using them for fabric, I have not tried them on anything else, but I think I will order another pair for cutting everything else. I wish I had discovered these a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: These scissors does cut like butter
customer_reviews.text: I love these scissors. I been cutting a lot of mask pattern. These does the work. Even on thicker fabric like flannels. Price are reasonable and will purchase a smaller version.
customer_reviews.author: Vincci

customer_reviews.title: The blades started sticking after a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: I have not had hand pain since I got these, and I use them A LOT. After a couple of weeks the blades were clean but somehow sticking, defeating the purpose of the spring action. They did come unstuck and release as expected eventually. Overall very happy but may invest in a higher quality pair next time.
customer_reviews.author: (fashionista)

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shears for all of three months, and have used them only on fabric and only periodically. Today when I went to use them, the blades stick together and won't open on their own. I have to physically open them myself, and really can't use them this way. These shears are meant to be used with the spring action, and are unusable when the blades stick/rub together. They haven't been dropped, so no idea why this happened. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I need for the joint problems in my hands and wrists from Lupus! I haven't been able to use scissors, then I remembered they make them like these!!! I can once again cut fabric without pain and difficulty! Plus, of course, Fiskars are super sharp and just awesome scissors! :-) I'm am so glad I ordered these. Great service and quick delivery, too.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Rosalini

customer_reviews.title: Work well but might not last long
customer_reviews.text: I gave these 3 stars because they do make cutting easier but...? I bought 2 pair, one for me and one for a friend. My pair doesn't cut all the way to the tip but my friends pair does. Also, the return spring action isn't working as good as it did when I first started using them a few months ago. Now, they kind of stick and you can feel them drag when they open.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Santee, Ca.

customer_reviews.title: Very good scissors
customer_reviews.text: This is life saving, whenever you need to cut a large amount of fabric or paper, it is life saving, your hands are going to thank you at the end. If you’re crafting on a daily basis you definitely need these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad to find these!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I found these as my hands begin to have problems. They are easy and comfortable to use. Only negatives are that they are a bit clumsy in tight turns (so I got the ones with small blades too) and they “clog up” with fabric residue and begin to stick open. I cleaned and oiled the spring and they’re working well again.
customer_reviews.author: beachwalker

customer_reviews.title: Spring load didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The scissors arrived in May 2020 and it is now July 2020 and the spring load feature no longer works. Our return/exchange window is closed otherwise we would exchange. It doesn't sound like this is a common problem. We have only used the scissors a handful of times being that they are for my 10 year old daughter and she is not cutting a crazy amount of fabric:). Any chance we can get an exchange?...
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Cuts fabric great
customer_reviews.text: My wife owns Quilting/Fabric store and uses these scissors to cut cut fabric for customers all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F.

customer_reviews.title: Keep getting different item
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if the item description and picture are wrong or if the person/machine packaging the item doesn’t know what to send. I have received the wrong item twice now. The description claims these are fabric scissors but I keep receiving multi purpose scissors. In the cutting fabric world, that’s a big difference. The picture also shows black/grey/with orange. Yet I keep getting orange and white. At this point I will return and spend my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great to use with arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: These scissors stay in the open position. They have nice big handles and are easy to use. Easy on the hands. All my fancy, expensive scissors require a movement to open them that hurts my arthritis. I do lots of sewing and cutting and these have been great. No more thumb pain.
customer_reviews.author: bay area shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love these! After many years as a secretary and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! After many years as a secretary and typing frequently, my hands don't love scissors as much as they used to. These scissors have been fantastic. They are very lightweight. They also lock closed. I use them for cutting fabric for sewing projects. They cut amazingly well. Got them on Amazon for at least $10 cheaper than in the fabric store. All in all, I am very pleased with this purchase. And I've had thoughts of buying another pair just to keep for the future
customer_reviews.author: D. TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. Not what I've come to expect from fiskars.
customer_reviews.text: The 1st couple of cuts I did with the scissors were like a dream. The next time I tried to cut anything what these scissors does scissors would close but then wouldn't open I thought the Spring was to make sure that They open with ease but that has not been the case they open about half way and just stay stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Emery

customer_reviews.title: best i ever had
customer_reviews.text: These never fail cutting cleanly. The little closed button surprised me because that made using 2 steps (an extra 2 seconds I guess.) I am hard on scissors so that forced me to take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: cats

customer_reviews.title: Needed oiling within first week
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for work, which involves cutting fleece. They were great for the first 3 days. On day 4 they would sometimes not spring themselves back open after I made a cut - instead of fully reopening they would open just wide enough to snip threads. By day 5 I was using 2 hands to pry the scissors back open after each cut. After oiling the blades they are springy again, but I didn't expect to have to perform weekly maintenance on a pair of scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Zolty

customer_reviews.title: Best Sissors I've Ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands ad find regular scissors hard to use. These Fiskars scissors have completely solved my problem. They are easy to lock/unlock, very easy to hold, and are believably sharp. As the title says, "Best Scissors I've Ever Used!"
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: First these are not as great as the old model (grey), but they must have their reason for change? The first pair I got were defective as the handle broke within 48 hours while I was cutting wrapping paper. Company was super about a return and replacement. That's all I can ask for!
customer_reviews.author: E. brennan

customer_reviews.title: These are the best.  Won’t be without them.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a pair of these for twenty years. They are essential. Makes cutting SO much easier on the hand. They are just now dull (I cut/sew almost every day). It would cost more to have them sharpened than to buy new pair, so got a second pair. Will probably order third pair in another twenty years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Defective as supplied
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional seamstress ( 50+ years), and frequently purchase scissors from Amazon. Price is less an issue than quality. This pair is worthless to me. If there is even one “nick” in a blade, they are worthless. These came with several nicks as supplied new, and where there is a nick, they don’t cut. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Soooo, I cut a piece of paper with her 'good fabric shears'.....and then
customer_reviews.text: These were one of two Fiskars replacements. They must be fine. She hasn't complained. I have a pair of Fiskars stashed away for myself. Never had a complaint. QUICKLY DELIVERED. Was only in dog house 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: SFC Z

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bunch!
customer_reviews.text: The scissors are sharp and smooth along the length of both blades and goes through fabric "like butter." The color is very pretty and makes them easier to find for those of us who "occasionally" lose things. (Yes, occasionally?) Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Love them~
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of ergonomic scissors and they're perfect! Fit great in my hand, easy to cut with. I have a little bit of arthritis and they are so easy to use. The glide thru paper with no problems. Wish I had bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Halgren

customer_reviews.title: I only buy Fiskars brand because of the spring action (arthritic hands)
customer_reviews.text: A great complement to the Fiskars 190500 RazorEdge Micro-Tip Easy Action Shears, 5 Inch. The two of them get a lot of use because I sew a lot. I learned the hard way to NEVER use fabric shears for anything but fabric and that pays off!
customer_reviews.author: lscs102

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were more comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted sharp comfortable scissors for cutting fabric. These are sharp enough, but I think these are uncomfortable to use. I'd say my hands are larger than the average woman because I have long fingers--but these scissors are wide to grip and to me aren't easy to use. They stay in the open position unless you use the lock to hold the blades closed. It's a nuisance to use the lock when you're done, and then unlock them every time you need to use them again. A person with very strong hands probably wouldn't have any problem. Just sayin'!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for arthritic hands!!
customer_reviews.text: No more pain in my thumb and fingers from using those ordinary scissors!! These spring-loaded scissors have been a life saver!! Stay sharp and work with precision. The blades have begun to "stick" slightly - not opening as readily after about 24 hours of actual use time.....I'll have to try to figure out ho to address that....
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Love my others like these, but these don’t work.
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL!!! I returned the first pair hoping I just got unlucky, but these are terrible!! They don’t pop back open so you have to physically open them each time causing instant hand cramping. I’ve had these scissors that I’ve bought before from a local craft store and I normally love them, but something is wrong with these. I can’t even use them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Pick

customer_reviews.title: Lefties Dream
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to sharpen left-hand scissors. So, I buy another pair as soon as they start hanging up. These came the very next day after they were ordered. I appreciated that. I immediately started using them to make more masks to share.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teacher scissors!
customer_reviews.text: Are you a teacher? If so, you NEED these scissors! I'm a special education education teacher which means I'm constantly laminating visuals with heavy duty laminate and then having to cut them out. It can be uncomfortable but these scissors are great and keep me from fatiguing. Definitely a great buy for teachers
customer_reviews.author: S. Schock

customer_reviews.title: Best scissors
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know how much I needed this scissors. They are the best scissors I have ever had. Super easy to hold and cut a few layers fabric. My hands used to hurt so much after cutting fabric. This has changed my life.
customer_reviews.author: Katirya Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I found these because they were suggested by a other special education teacher. Now my Paras always want to use them, too. So I might need to get a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shaker

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money to stop the frustration.
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are perfect if you have any type of arthritis in your hands or paralysis. They remain sharp and can cut through anything in general. I have three pair. Worth the money to stop the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Audible Fan

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am a MAJOR Fiskar fan - my only complaint is after the first time using them, the spring is a little slower for a smooth open shut that isn't hard on my wrist. Perfect cut, the actual cut is very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: peachyspeechy

customer_reviews.title: Loved the product, but
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs of these scissors to cut paper flowers. For both pairs the spring kept getting stuck after minimal use. There’s no point of getting these scissors if the spring does not work. I am disappointed, especially reading the reviews that people have been using these scissors for years. If I buy nice scissors, I expect them to last. Amazon sent me one replacement scissor but at this point, I have lost my trust in this product. They are amazing scissors, they don’t hurt your hand. I only used it for a bit and they became unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Bernaaa

customer_reviews.title: Relief for sore hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought these scissors for my husband, who has developed pretty severe arthritis in both thumbs. He loves them! The spring action returning them to the open position is more of a relief than I expected. And you can use more of your hand to close them. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nola H Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis relief!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a pleasure to use. My arthritic hands and wrists really appreciate the ease of using this scissors.
customer_reviews.author: joshuavii

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: These scissors work just fine. I bought them thinking cutting would be easier with the spring-loaded design. I find cutting to be more difficult, because each time I squeeze the scissors closed, I am working against the spring. I prefer regular scissors.
customer_reviews.author: MrsStrickland

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted a pair of this style fiskars 'years' ago ... thought I was ordering the same quality. The lock button doesn't slide, it sticks badly and the plastic feels cheap. The plastic on the handles feel cheaper and the the grip has no texture to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah's Corner

customer_reviews.title: I loved these when they arrived but after using a short ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pair one for use upstairs and the other for downstairs. The upstairs pair is used more frequently. I loved these when they arrived but after using a short time the Spring in the pair I use more often doesn’t spring open. Too late to return. I’m hoping the other pair lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Precision and Comfort!

Size:10-InchesWinner of the Arthritis Foundation Ease-of-Use Commendation, our Easy Action Scissors are the perfect choice for people with arthritis or limited hand strength. A spring-action design opens the blades after each cut, greatly reducing the effort needed for this basic motion. High-grade, stainless-steel blades feature a precision-ground edge that stays sharp longer and cuts all the way to the tip — essential for anyone who cuts fabric. An ergonomically sculpted handle with Softgrip provides excellent cutting control and comfort, and a bent handle design keeps materials flat for precise cuts every time.

Softouch Multi-Purpose Shears cut leather, upholstery, vinyl's, cardboard and more. SoftGrip material on smooth contour handle offers more comfort and less slipping while cutting.
